Under normal circumstances the punishment ladder for the IFS is as followed: 

Strike 1: 10-game chat restriction.
Strike 2: 25-game cr.
Strike 3: 14-day ban.
Strike 4: permanent ban.

Certain types of behavior though, such as hate speech, racist comments and gameplay-related offenses (trolling, inting, etc.) gets an immediate 14-day ban or a permaban depending on the severity and ones punishment history. However, it is possible to gradually get ones account back in good standing by showing enough of a reformation effort over an extended period of time, which is likely what happened here.

Robbing a store with a gun will net 15 years min probably. Yet shoplifting will start with small punishments and slowly escalate to jail time as well.

Please don't make comparisons to the criminal justice system because most modern systems have recognized this does nothing but ensure you will always have crime and full prisons.

It has the opposite effect you'd expect it to, and it's better to address the root causes, and they've started shifting towards restorative justice more and more.

Clearly Riot doesn't care more about the community than they do profit, and they've decided it's not their job to administer justice (probably rightly so). They just indiscriminately and very imprecisely throw people's accounts away as a patch job.

My only annoyance with their policies, is that they are deluded enough to think it's a reformative system. It's fine how it is, but don't give yourself credit where it's not due.
